Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kyra T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an amazing value for your buck. The rooms are clean, well laid out, big, full of amenities and well kept. It's in a great location. My husband and I walked everywhere. Lots of shopping, grocery stores, bars and resturaunts close by. Also in a great location to get to lots of attractions. The ONLY down side: the parking sucks. If you are renting, get a small compact car or it won't fit in the garage. And parking is "free but not guaranteed". We didn't have any problems getting a spot, but there aren't a lot. Would defiantly stay her again

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bob T
Reviews.Content: Was checked in by the General Manger, Rick, who was hard at work on a sunny Sunday afternoon. What an awesome person! He gave us a fantastic rate and the room was superb with all amenties we needed along with a king size bed. The hotel is a botique style property that meets the PLUS standards. Highly recommend this property to all travellers be it business or pleasure. Your stay will be a memorable one with the fantastic staff and level of service we experienced also. This property is very close to all transit services and a within walking distance to Rogers Arena or BC Place. When you visit Vancouver make sure you check out the Best Western Plus Uptown Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 day stay”
Reviews.Author: bullpasture5555
Reviews.Content: the people at the desk were very friendly and helpfull especially at giving directions for places in Vancouver. price of the room was very good considering being in Vancouver. rooms are odd shapes because of hotel design. really like the tall ceilings. found parking stalls limited and quite small

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and good value”
Reviews.Author: Tripsterchick
Reviews.Content: Absolutely recommend this hotel if you’re looking for somewhere in the vicinity of Vancouver General Hospital. Our room was smaller than at some other Best Westerns we’ve stayed at but didn’t feel in any way cramped, and we had everything we needed – very comfortable bed and pillows, good wifi signal, microwave and fridge (both available on request) and free underground parking (for Vancouver, that’s a bit of a find). The rates are very reasonable, especially for somewhere so close to downtown. I was a little worried that being on the ground floor, our room might be noisy, but we heard no sounds from inside or outside the hotel. The room had a double door off the corridor; the space between the outer and inner doors probably absorbed any sounds from guests using the corridor. And our window was actually well above street level, providing privacy and quiet. The ground-floor rooms overlook a back street that has virtually no traffic. A continental breakfast is included. We try to eat gluten free, sometimes a challenge with hotel breakfasts, so we were pleased to find the selection included oatmeal, yogurt, egg patties/omelets, bananas and apples. Also discovered a gluten-free bakery called Mygoodness just a two-minute walk away at 235 East Broadway, and around the corner from it, the Wallflower Modern Diner at 2420 Main Street, which has gluten-free options. The Salt and Pepper Grill and Bar next door to the hotel serves tasty food and gives a 10% discount on presentation of your room key. And there are countless restaurants and coffee shops within easy walking distance. The Kingsgate Mall is just across the street from the hotel. It has a supermarket, pharmacy and numerous other stores.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for location and price!”
Reviews.Author: KimbertEyestain
Reviews.Content: I usually use Priceline to score 4 star hotels in Vancouver; and, during this time of the year, you can usually get a great deal. I tried a couple times to score a room for the 70-80 dollar range with Priceline. Then I thought about it: Yes, the 4 star hotels generally have beautiful rooms. But they are downtown and I would have to pay for parking and internet. That would bump up my daily room price to 120 dollars a night (including the taxes and fees of PL). That's 30 dollars toward a good meal in Vancouver! So, I decided to look elsewhere. This Best Western is in the Mount Pleasant neighborhood - filled with great restaurants and shops on Main, Broadway, and Kingsway. I am kind at the phase of my Vancouver traveling, that I'm not too interested in going downtown. From this hotel, you can walk Broadway and catch the 99 bus to Kits, or Granville or you can walk to the waterfront. The best perk is that it comes with free parking. The first morning, I woke up, looked out my window, and saw a classic Vancouver smash and grab-broken car window. Their parking is very secure but small. Free internet! They also have a nice free continental breakfast - my only complaint is that the coffee in the room tasted better than the coffee they served. Luckily, there is a good coffee shop on Main street just one block away. I would also suggest getting a room not on the first floor. We paid their rockbottom internet prices, so I wasn't surprised that we were on the first floor. It wasn't too bad until the Saturday night-hustle woke me up a couple of times. But, our room was clean, and that is the most important to me!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, especially for the great price!”
Reviews.Author: Erathge
Reviews.Content: Got a standard room for 75 dollars per night. Thought that was a great deal. As others have mentioned, get a room facing the side street, and on the fourth floor with the high ceilings. Location was OK, but hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: willchaffey
Reviews.Content: In my opinion the BEST WESTERN PLUS Uptown Hotel is a hidden gem. A great hotel just outside the centre but bus stops right outside if you don't have a car but you can easilly walk into the centre between 25-35 mins depending how energetic you feel. Everyone who worked at the hotel was really nice from the front desk to the cleaners. The rooms are comfortable,clean and quiet. Yes sometimes the breakfast room is crowded but just take it to your room or sit in reception. Also some people say the car park is small but never had any bother getting parked but there are plenty of street parkingplaces available.

Reviews.Title: “near the hospital”
Reviews.Author: missingthebuffet
Reviews.Content: If for some reason you are needing to stay near the hospital, this is a good location. The room was very nice and comfortable. The breakfast was very good. Near lots of shopping. It's only a 5 min drive from the hospital. They give a very good rate as well if you are there because of treatments, check ups or whatever. Not far from the sky station

Reviews.Title: “affordable pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Ivoryfarm
Reviews.Content: I love the 4th floor's high ceiling: looks great and full of fresh air in the room. The room cen not be any cleaner! It was spotless! The breakfast was nicer than I thought:lots of fresh pastries, my favorite! The juice, coffee, hot water was avaliable most time of the day, not just at breakfast hours. The front desk agent was nice to apply a Best Western membership card for me while checked in, so I was able to receive some points after the stay. Perfect location to stay after my dad had an eye surgery at a nearby hospital and need to re-check at the eye care center not far away on the next early morning. The only Downside is: Double beds are too small and next door's noise were easy to hear and bothered me a bit at nightime......

Reviews.Title: “good low cost location near Grandville”
Reviews.Author: odan
Reviews.Content: Located on Broadview and Main, close to Grandville ave with lots of shops and dining, easy to get downtown without having to pay high prices. Secure, underground parking is free and continental breakfast is inlcuded. Handy shopping mall across the road. Good value for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place - stinks of marijuana, staff hopeless (poor communication), lousy neighbourhood, tired hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wild1wild
Reviews.Content: Hated our 2 day stay. Our floor stank of marijuana both nights and when we complained the second night we were told we weren't the first to complain, that the housekeeping should have noticed and told front desk (sure blame the housekeeper when the idiots were bound to have do not disturb on the door), and that they couldn't do anything about it. It was sickening and smelt in the lifts, hall and also our room. Especially bad when you are travelling with a small child. They also don't have cots or cribs for small children - they said they weren't in use already, there literally weren't any. Don't go here if you are travelling with a small child as ours ended up on the floor on pillows - lucky he is 2 and not 6 to 12 months! The neighbourhood is not great either - lots of rough looking people around and saw several using the garden out front for toileting. All in all gross. Friends nearby recommended Richmond area for next visit as it is affordable but easy to get to downtown via sky train. Just go anywhere but here. Manager said when I checked out he had only just been told about it because I had phoned best western central number to complain. I told him to read his own communication diary as it was already 10 am but was in there the day before. He then blamed night staff for not telling him! I would have thought breech of smoking policy (fire hazard) and especially with illegal substances, with multiple complaints would have been reported to management on the day! Useless place. Has put me off best western totally.

Reviews.Title: “The Travellers from the UK”
Reviews.Author: Pauline469
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September before we cruised to Alaska and found the staff to be very friendly and efficient. The room was large and very comfortable. Breakfast was included and was plentiful. Lots of visitors at the hotel due to conferences but we always found a table. Coffee facilities were in room and good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: alih68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of September(should have been 3, but thanks to Aer Lingus spent 1 night at Heathrow). We were on the ground floor, the room had high ceilings and was quite old fashioned but clean. Breakfast in the morning was plentiful but a bit of a squeeze and as we were right next to the breakfast room, there was no chance of a lie in as the chair scraping started at 7am. The staff were friendly and helpful and there is a supermarket right across the road. I would recommend the hotel to anyone staying in Vancouver on a budget, it is about a 30 min walk to Gastown, but just be careful as we met a lot of unsavoury characters just when you leave Chinatown and that was only about 9pm.

Reviews.Title: “Plus ?”
Reviews.Author: jpchoisne
Reviews.Content: After having staid at the BW+ in Kelowna, we expected much more from this hotel and were extremely disappointed. On the truly + side were the free parking and really speedy free wifi. Leave your car here and grab the number 8 or 19 at the nearby bus stop and you're quickly downtown. Apart from this the hotel badly needs renovation and his rather gloomy. Everything looks old and sad in this place. The lobby is small and unpractical. The rooms are average size and beds are too short if you're over 6 ft (my case). The breakfast room is small and noisy and the choice of food limited and very basic. The elevator is slow and you have to wait for it ages. Some of the staff are ok, some merely so-so. I wonder why criteria are chosen by BW to grant the + label but this hotel certainly does not deserve it. Business centre is a joke

Reviews.Title: “Good combination of price/location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Shaunr52
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in a great location. Offseason rates of $75 per night is a steal given the location. Hotel is within walking distance of many restaurants (Burgoos on Main is well worth the hike) and there is a mall across the street. Rooms are average sized and reasonably appointed. Above average selection of pastries at the included breakfast. Fitness area leave a bit to be desired and the hotel does not have a pool/hot tub area. All in all, this is a very solid choice for the area. I will stay here again especially in the offseason.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased...”
Reviews.Author: mosari
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have checked into best western hotels in man places in the world and have been nothing but pleased with the service. In Vancouver the break fast in this hotel was very tasty. Although sometimes the room was packed and we had to wait for a few minutes, but who cares about a few minutes on vacation. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The drain was not ok in the first day and they fixed it as soon as we let them know. In general I totally recommend this hotel for people who are in Vancouver for sight seeing and are not extremely picky about the luxurious stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SusanFromVancIsland
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times now. It is my favorite place to stay when I have to travel to Vancouver given its 'uptown' location, reasonable rates, free secure parking, complimentary large and varied breakfasts, comfortable beds, high ceilings, 40 minute walking distance to the downtown SFU campus (where I attend the occasional 2-3 day courses), etc. I am disappointed when it is full and I have to find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Best Western”
Reviews.Author: VanessaMunYee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not located downtown Vancouver although it is not far from town if you have a car- only a few minutes from downtown. The bedroom is in average size and cleans. Our king size bed was comfortable and clean. There was a TV, working desk and chair, sofa and coffer maker. We like the free wireless internet services provided by the hotel and the complimentary continental breakfast was good. The bathroom was clean and spacious. It came with a bathtub with enough amenities. Personally, I like the full size mirror closet door >.< Nothing really special and we do not mind to come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a good choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: judith081
Reviews.Content: we booked in here for the last night of our holiday prior to flying home.The room was tired looking,in need of an update and quite cramped.There weren't any tea making facilities although the front desk did get us some hot (not boiling)water.Breakfast in the morning was in a very small windowless room with only 7 or 8 tables. This resulted in queues and people unable to get seats,I think they went back to their rooms to eat. I didn't see any sign of a cooked option and we served ourselves using paper plates,bowls and cups.Definitely wouldn't go back although Christopher who checked us in would be an asset to any hotel,he was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: juandrew
Reviews.Content: We are still at the hotel as I write this (waiting for kids to get ready!). This is our second, and last night and we are really pleased with the hotel. Firstly parking at such a busy place is a godsend - and it's free. Would agree with other comments it's a bit of a tight squeeze, but we have left the car there and used the bus to get around town (buy your ticket from drug store in nearby mall). The staff have all been absolutely brillaint. Really friendly and very helpful in every way. The rooms are very clean - I think newly decorated. Beds really comfy and the hotel was very quiet. The free breakfast was plentiful lots of pastry, cereal, toast etc. Yes, only a little space but you can go to your room so i don't see that as a problem. We hired bikes at Bikes on Robsons (see free map at reception) which was much cheaper that in Stanley Park, and had a great time cycling all round. It is very flat so great for someone like me who has not been on a bike since teenage years. We cycled to the ferry for Granville Island and chained bikes there. The ferry is about $5 return and we had a great time on Granville island - a great covered food market where you could get just about anything to eat. Beautiful fruit stalls. Lots of galleries and art shops to see. Dont miss the broom shop! We eat halibut at Go Fish as reccommended by a local. Long wait and a battle to get seated but brilliant food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Price!”
Reviews.Author: holidayers007
Reviews.Content: Hotel offers free secure undercover parking. Free Continental Breakfast is good. Room was clean and spacious. Free in room internet. Close driving distance to downtown and Stanley Park. Go to Happy Feet Massage if looking for a real massage.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: TomBruno23
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights with my wife on vacation. Great location in a neighborhood with a ton of restaurants and it's only a short (5-10 min) drive to downtown. Parking garage underneath hotel, but spots can be tough to find late at night (parking on the street). Also has a grocery store directly across the street. Friendly staff, good continental (free) breakfast each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel & convienient location !”
Reviews.Author: UKRobali
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable beds and bathroom, great continental breakfast with wide selection (cereal, bagels, pastries, toast, coffee, juice, etc), very easy to get downtown by hopping on a bus outside the door, safe neighbourhood, friendly staff. Would definetely stay here again and would recommend as good value for money and a quality hotel (stayed for 3x nights in the end)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special - just "okay" for a couple of days...”
Reviews.Author: kironb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for business in the vicinity. The good: * close to some good restaurants and easily accessible by public transit * wireless Internet was very fast but did require frequent reauthentication * nice view of downtown Vancouver and the mountains from 3rd and 4th floor rooms that were facing 10th Ave * decent price for Vancouver - booked on hotel website and got AAA rate of just over $120 per night The Bad: * one of the worst fitness rooms I have seen. Opens late (8 AM), water bottle empty, 1 working elliptical trainer (other was broken), 1 ancient bike and 1 old treadmill and a very limited number of light free weights. The room is a solarium on the top floor with no ventilation so it felt like a sauna. * Room while spacious and clean was dated - old CRT television, ancient AC unit, no mosquito screens on windows * Limited continental breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: brettandalex
Reviews.Content: Location- about 10-15 minute combined bus and sky train journey to main attractions which was ok as only cost 9 dollars per day per person. Breakfast- was ok, very basic help yourself cereal, toast, pastries and juice etc. Room- was fine, nothing special but in comparison was cheap. Bed comfy, and everything was clean. Overall- not bad for money, quiet hotel. Location has ups and downs as was a fair distance from downtown but had supermarket close by.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money paid”
Reviews.Author: HarmonizerHK
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Best Western website and I got the best rate ever (~CDN 83 incl tax for a booking of consecutive 4 nights). I got a single bed room, very comfortable bed, free internet, free continential breakfast, and more importantly, very friendly and helpful staff. I was originally flied to Tokyo after my stay in Vancouver, but I had to change flight to skip Tokyo because of earthquake, then I had to stay in Vancouver for 2 more days, and I really appreciated the hotel staff (forgot his name) to quickly settle this matter for me. Indoor parking might be a challenge as space would be kind of congested if parked with other cars. There was a time I found it too challenging to park inside, so I parked the car at night on 10th avenue just outside the hotel. Not a problem then.

Reviews.Title: “Real-time review, surprisingly excellent”
Reviews.Author: dgdevil
Reviews.Content: I'm here now, halfway through a weeklong business-related stay. Everything's very clean and quiet, just as I like. Breakfast, always a big deal for me, is good - three types of cereal, two types of milk, and a ton of pastries, bread, as well as juice and coffee. It would be nice if the milk jugs + yogurts were placed in a tray filled with ice, but I can get over that. The hotel is on the #19 bus route, taking you either downtown in one direction, or to the Metrotown mall with a big movie theater, in the other. The Canada line tram from the airport is about a half-dozen blocks away. There's also a strip mall and a supermarket next door. The Mt. Pleasant neighborhood gets a mention in LP as the hipster SoMa area. There's a lot of little coffeehouses, etc., and a string of stores selling outdoor gear. Sleeping was solid, though my room is next to a maid's storage area, and I was awoken at 7:30 a.m. today when she unlocked it to retrieve something. But overall, I'm not hearing noise from adjacent rooms, upstairs or from the street. Front-desk crew are helpful. No Pets Allowed is a huge plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ChristyB44
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver last week for a business gathering with and few clients. I was able to find the hotel very easily and the lady at the desk was very helpful. When I arrived at the room it was very nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “for the price - unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: ErikT_10
Reviews.Content: got a great deal through booking.com pros: price ( unbelievable for being in the city, parking & continental breakfast incl ), location, cleanliness, FREE PARKING, exercise room (beautiful solarium with OUTSTANDING view of van ), free wi-fi internet cons: floor above ( 4th )noisy when people walking...2 nights ok- 3rd night heavy footed person woke me early in the morning with thud-thud-thud; continental breakfast very basic and if you get there later its slim pickins and they don't seem quick to replenish items; exercise room open 8am - 8pm ( too late in morning and too early at night ) ; elevator can be very slow ( but only 4 floors so I always used stairs )

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - great for exploring Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: AliHammer
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with the Best Western Uptown. The room was very clean & comfortable - nice bed, kettle/coffee maker, tv, alarm clock radio, bathroom with bath & shower & lots of toiletries. The free continental breakfast was great as there was a large selection of food to choose from & it was constantly being replenished by the staff. The dining room could do with being a little bigger as it was always full but most guests were considerate enough to let you share their table & make room as soon as they'd finished. There was free wi-fi in the room and also free use of the computer & printer in the lobby. The parking garage was a little tricky to manouvre in if you had a big car (luckily Steve did all the driving) - apparently there are only 40 spaces but they have 70 rooms so they don't charge for parking as they can't guarantee a spot although we always found one and the hotel was full for a couple of nights of our stay. The hotel is away from downtown Vancouver but as we had a car we had no trouble getting around however there seemed to be plenty of buses along Kingsway which is literally steps away from the front door (if you need to park your car in Vancouver check out the 'Easy Park' website - the prices for each lot vary considerably as well as the opening times but we found them really useful.) There is a Starbucks and a Tim Hortons within 5 minutes walk of the hotel and a few cafes & restaurants although we only tried one (a Mongolian Grill - very reasonable as it was an 'all-u-can-eat' and the chef cooks the raw ingredients that you have chosen.) The gym was very small but had enough pieces of equipment in it to keep me busy for a while - bike, 2 x cross-trainers/skiers, treadmill, free weights, bench & mats. The only complaint I would have about this hotel is the lack of soundproofing between rooms - we had a young family next to us for a few days & heard every sound their 'excitable' children made all night & almost resorted to leaving our TV on to muffle the noise. The next guests left their alarm clock to go off after they'd left & that woke us up through the walls the next morning as if it was in our room! All in all we were very pleased with our stay, it was just what we wanted and was ideal for getting into town or out into the surrounding areas due to its proximity to several main routes (Kingsway, Main Street, Broadway etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Great find (thanks to TripAdvisor)!”
Reviews.Author: Amelians
Reviews.Content: It's hard to imagine a better value in pricey Vancouver. Great in-town location with public transportation and many good restaurants nearby. Pleasant, helpful staff. Free parking under the hotel (but bring good driving skills and, if possible, a small car, because turns are tight and most spaces are narrow). Our room--assigned according to our requested location--was very comfortable but smaller than those at most places we stay. This posed no problem at all since, of course, we didn't travel to beautiful Vancouver to spend any more time than necessary in our hotel room! I found the complaints here about the small breakfast area unwarranted since there's table space for a couple of dozen people and, after all, it's not intended to be, or advertised as, a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: fampaz
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before booking this hotel and thanks to other reviews I took a chance and was not disappointed. I got a decent rate by booking through a third party compared to other hotels that are in closer to the middle of town. But the great thing about Vancouver is that everything is relatively close. We were able to buy a day pass for $9 Canadian and jump on the Metro (there is a bus stop within walking distance from the hotel). That bus took us all the way to Stanley Park (about a 15min ride) which is must see- we rented bicycles and rode around the perimeter of the park- beautiful! The hotel itself offered all basic amenities and although there was nothing spectacular about it, it was clean,the beds were comfortable and the staff was friendly. Yes, the breakfast room was quite small- but i must admit I was impressed by their selection of danish/muffins etc. There is a restaurant next door that offers a nice, hot alternative but not if you are in a hurry- the service in Vancouver is friendly, but slow! The underground mall next door was convenient for last minute toiletries. If you want souvenirs- go to the Sears on Robson Street- you can find some great deals on Olympic wear! I hope to visit Vancouver again soon (I was only there for 3 nights for a wedding) and I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “It was alright”
Reviews.Author: tmx218
Reviews.Content: Not the greatest location for parking, rooms were clean, however they were small. The rest of the hotel was small too with a slow elevator. Upon checkout, the one who helped us out wasn't the most talkative and didn't even ask us how our stay was. I'd say the stay was alright but you definitely have to be prepared for a smaller than expected room

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: seveneighty
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a very good price ($400 for 3 nights with a corporate code), especially considering Vancouver prices. We expected a run-down hotel in the middle of nowhere, but got something else entirely. Where else in Vancouver can you find a hotel with free parking? And free breakfast and free wi-fi? The wi-fi works perfectly, and the breakfast is very decent (as long as you take it outside or up to your room, don't torture yourself by sitting in the extremely cramped breakfast room). The elevators are very slow, so don't be lazy -- just take the stairs, you'll save tons of time and get some exeercise. We didn't have much of a view, but the location was perfect for our needs as it is in the middle of a Asian/Vietnamese area... meaning tons of cheap good food surrounded us. Everything else is just a short trip away. We always felt safe. The free parking was excellent around the hotel, but we never tried the underground parking which seemed a little cramped. The lobby is small, but who cares? it's perfectly pleasant, and offers a computer with internet and a printer. Service was excellent, the hotel was comfortable -- the rooms weren't extravant but they were perfect. The halls are bright and beautiful, which came as a pleasant surprise. Couldn't expect more for a well-priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: UKTinkerbell
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean hotel. It is easy to find from Vancouver airport and there is parking both at the hotel and in nearby streets if the hotel carpark is full. Breakfast is basic cereal, toast, muffins but was perfectly okay. The cost was reasonable. There is also a Buy-Lo supermarket across the road. Oh and there's free wi-fi too. The staff are very helpful and friendly. We had a twin room which was very well proportioned. The hotel is not that close to the city centre main area and parking in the city can be expensive/challenging so you may want to eat in the local restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with great service”
Reviews.Author: TakeitEasy04
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel conveniently located. Room on the 4th floor #412 was spacious, had a nice view, bath w/jacuzzi, filling breakfast ( free) and greta service. Bus stop and mall at footstep. we highly recommend it and will go stay again :)

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, free parking, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: doctamale
Reviews.Content: Our inital reason for staying here was this was the most affordable Best Western in the area, and they offered free parking. The reservation staff was polite. When first arriving, park on the street or in adjacent grocery parking lot, as the "structure" needs a room key to enter. We put "structure" in quotes as this includes approxiamately 10 cozy underground spaces; first come first served. Note, however, even with a 'no vacancy' situation we found a space in the evening. There is one elevator, which can prove frustrating during busy times (breakfast). The rooms are comfortable with basic amenities and lovely high ceilings. The window opened, and the air conditioning was adequate. Everything smelled and looked clean and appeared well maintained. The beds were comfortable and extra pillows were provided. All in all, comfortable and adequate accomodations. The 4th floor gym/solarium had a beautiful view and basic equipment. The continental breakfast, while crowded and seemingly standard fare, was remarkably delicious. Eat at least 3 apple fritters :-). The only real drawback, which could be avoided with proper planning, was the near complete lack of food establishments within walking distance. The hotel seems to be located in the automotive district, which meant quiet streets but a paucity of places open after 8PM. The mall (if you can call it a mall) across the street consisted of an off brand grocer, drug store and a Payless Shoes. No microwave in the room meant limited options for in room dining. There is an attached restaurant which does provide room service until around 9PM. Finally, if you're looking for activities other than food, much of Vancouver closes fairly early, however this hotel has you well out of the loop. All in all, a good value with comfortable rooms with reasonable access to the city by car. The neighborhood appears safe. Friendly staff and apple fritters rounded out an overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but great for what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: letterdude
Reviews.Content: As we were attending a specific family event, and didn't need to go downtown, our primary concern was getting into a decent hotel - at a decent price - close to the family gathering. This place suited our needs. Very unassuming signage. If you're unfamiliar with the area, you can drive right by the hotel. The underground parking is free with the understanding that it's very cramped and first come, first served. No guarantee that there will be an available stall. Lots of parking, outdoors, all around the hotel, though. Very small lobby. Reminded me more of a hostel. Helpful, efficient check-in staff. 4 floors. If you're a smoker - or inhale glaucoma medication - you'll want to get on the 2nd floor, as there is a cool, little courtyard. Room 219 is directly across from the access. The room, itself, had a "different" kind of layout. The part with the bed and furniture was standard. It's just that the hallway access, once you enter the room, is narrow and kinda' long. Perhaps this is due to the shape of the building and number of rooms. Average sized bathroom. Well-lit with a small jacuzzi tub. We had a king-size bed. Comfortable. No bothersome external noise, to speak of. A/C worked well. Housekeeping was good, if a little late in the day. That can happen anywhere, though. Wifi worked without a problem. We didn't really use the free breakfast. Nice little restaurant is attached. We did a couple of meals in there and were very satisfied. No pool. 9 times out of 10, we wouldn't care, but, as we had an afternoon to spare and Vancouver was enjoying a sunny heatwave, it would have been one of those times! All in all, we got good value and everything was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JuliaCooper
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable hotel; no frills ( it's a BW, not a 4 Seasons ! ), just everything you need. The location is good, especially when you drive here by car, because parking your car is free of charge + bus to downtown is nearby. You buy a day pass on public transportation and go wherever you want all day long. Breakfast ( also free ) was quite good. Just a pitty there's only 1 computer and it's in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby-looking location but convenient to all of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: hebergal
Reviews.Content: I love Best Westerns for their cheap prices, consistent cleanliness, and good continental breakfasts and this was no exception. With only about 20 underground parking spots I was incredibly nervous about parking my rental car on the street in what appeared to be a possibly shady part of town, but I had no problems. We were only a five minute drive from Yaletown, Granville Island, and all the other great downtown amenities. My biggest annoyance with this BW was that there was a room service tray of stinky food, etc. in my hallway for several hours and when I mentioned it to the person at the front desk they just acted like someone on the next shift was responsible for it.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, good situated, small rooms and small breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: singel
Reviews.Content: The room (1 queen) was quite small, but included tv, free wireless internet, koffiemaker, airco,... . The hotel is situated somewhat out of city center, but with buses 8 and 19 you are in 15 minutes in the city centre. Bus 19 takes you even to Stanley Park. Buy your tickets in the Shoppers Drug Mart in the small mall just besides the hotel. We did not use the dayticket but bought a book of 10 tickets which was rather enough for two days. Bus 8 stops at waterfront station which is a good starting point of a visit to Vancouver. The breakfast room is very small, but the complimentary continental breakfast is good an adequately refilled by a nice lady. You can have fruit juice (machine), coffee (nescafe machine), toasts, philadelkphia cheese, marmelade, cereals, fruit, hard-boiled eggs,...

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Portalberni10
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were attending a wedding and the location was convenient. We had no expectations as the area is not one we normally visit. The front desk service was excellent. The room was spacious and clean. The hotel is situated close to a mall for picking up forgotten items. There is free secured parking and a nice continental breakfast. For the price we were very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Speedy-Vesper
Reviews.Content: Even though reception was neither helpful nor efficient, the room was more than adequate. Location was really good, especially for Rocky Mountaneer travellers. Free WLAN and breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Pjjbro
Reviews.Content: Cindy and Rick are to be commended for outstanding customer service!!! They made our stay exceptional. Especially Cindy. She gave us directions, made recommendations on what to see, where to eat and when asked clued us in on the areas to we should avoid. She patiently answered a thousand questions. She is particularity credited with our time at the Uptown being so pleasant. When we checked in we were given a room facing the street. We requested a quiet room and they moved us to another room on the second floor. It was the handicap room. The room was tight and small and the view was of the parking lot across the street BUT it was QUITE. (I would recommend you request a room at the back on the 3rd or 4th floor.) The carpet in our room needed a shampoo but the rest of the room was very clean. The mattress was covered in a zipped liner under the pad and linens. The fitness room on the 4th floor is small but charming with glass windows all around. It is private but provides a wonderful view while working out. There is also a small garden on the 2nd floor. Parking is very secure and free. We ended up not using our car at all. We took Cindy's suggestion and used the convenient and very clean public transportation. Rick suggest the Hop on Hop Off tour (great suggestion). Our daughter came to visit us for one night during our stay. Cindy accommodated us with extra bedding for her stay (no additional charge). There are several restaurants and pubs just a couple of blocks from the hotel. We had a delightful dinner at CAFE RUSTICO. Check it out if you want authentic Italian food at a great price and unbelievable service. The owner genuinely enjoys his guests and treats you as if you are a visitor in his home. I have mentioned it several times, but it can not be said enough, the customer service at the Uptown Best Western was unsurpassed. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Uptown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Researcher
Reviews.Content: I spent eight nights in this hotel, which was a great value and a great stay. It was certainly a step above what you might expect for the price/star rating: really comfortable beds, beautiful views, very high ceilings (on the 4th floor), reliable high-speed internet and very clean, modern surroundings. The location is perfect, being right on the 99 B-Line which is one stop away from the Canada Line, a few stops from the Skytrain, and on the direct line to UBC. The breakfast room was perfectly fine, despite what many of the other reviews state. Sure, it didn't have any windows, but it was fairly spacious and had a great complimentary selection of pastries, bagels, hard-boiled eggs, etc. I've stayed in several hotels and this was a great place, and I'll be staying there in the future. The staff was very friendly, the cleanliness perfect, and all in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Dollar”
Reviews.Author: BO2GO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel April 16th & 17th.2010 and have to admit I was impressed. We had room #216 which faced the inside courtyard, was nice and quite, bed was very comfortable and clean (no bed bugs). Staff was very friendly, continental breakfast was good (lot's to select from). Salt & Pepper Grill next door, small mall across the street.Underground parking is limited, but we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ikbeans
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this hotel! Definately above the standard Best Western experience. I was there on business, but it really ended up feeling like a mini-vacation while at the hotel. Great service, super comfy bed, great location...the breakfast was nothing to write home about, but totally decent and there are some cute coffee shops nearby if you something a little nicer. Overall it was a great time! The free underground parking was a definate plus! I also liked being next to a grocery store, definately saved me some money during my extended stay. There are lots of great resturants within walking distance too.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs! Bed bugs! Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: GilbertJ
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel at 10:00 p.m. and went to bed at 11:00 pm. At 2:00 p.m., I woke up feeling itchy. I had about 300 bed bug bites covering my entire body and face. My husband had no bites. I had a allergic reaction to them. The hotel was not professional about the incident. We had to leave the hotel at 3:00 a.m. and throw out everything we had in the hotel with us. The hotel took five months paying us back for our loss. We were in town for job interviews and had just arrived in Vancouver. We got there at night and left the following night. After, I spent the day at the hospital getting treated. DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL! It's a new and nice hotel but not if you want bed bug bites or to take them home with you. If you get them in your house it will be a nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: maestro
Reviews.Content: Vancouver hotels are usually expensive. This hotel is notable for its great value; reliable Best Western comfort and good value in an expensive city. I stayed twice in the past week in two separate rooms. Pros: *Comfortable beds *Good lighting *Good work stations for laptops (free Best Western wireless) *Nice furniture *Good location if you have a car or are using the bus, looks like a 10 minute walk to Science World *Secure underground parking *Great staff, at both the Front Desk and in the Housekeeping department *Complimentary breakfast with good quality food *Grocery store right next door Cons: *Old fashioned TVs… where are the flat screens? *Fitness Centre does not open until 8:00 AM. This is nuts! *Some of the rooms facing the main drag can be noisy from the traffic below. Request a room along the side or at the back.

Reviews.Title: “cozy and easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: Van3000
Reviews.Content: Front desk a bit slow, girl at front when I checked out seemed more interested in her phone convo than dealing with a guest. Room was f-r-e-e-z-i-n-g when we checked in. (Right beside the weight room so really drafty) We had to wait about an hour for the heater to warm up the room. Washroom remained icy as no air flow in there. All in all restaurant was good, room was clean, and a really reasonable rate I would stay there again but next time I'll request a warmer room.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: beverley013
Reviews.Content: had a great time time here - stayed two weeks and no complaints. lovely room with a huge bed which was so comfy and breakfast was a bonus. close to local shops and transport system and easily within walking distance of downtown vancouver if youre feeling energetic. loved it here and hope to return in 2011

Reviews.Title: “Nicely equipped even for 2 weeks”
Reviews.Author: PatLeeFamily
Reviews.Content: Arrived here and writing this review on the very first day! I'm very impressed with the room itself as it has all the necessary things which i didnt expect for a hotel that was meant to be 2-3 star. It has microwave, wifi, fridge, iron, ironing board, and so much more which I didnt expect! Really nice welcome for me... coming all the way from Malaysia and a tiring 18 hour journey! Will write more ...as the stay progresses, of my impressions. But so far, so good... I'd recommend this place thus far..

Reviews.Title: “Canada / Us Road trip”
Reviews.Author: ChrisC3
Reviews.Content: Very clean and nice, Friendly and helpfull Staff. Good central Location, Very safe parking.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the good Reviews- this hotel is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: mistermaui
Reviews.Content: The UPtown is just that- not DOWNtown, but is easily accessed by bus from the train or Skytrain stations on Main Street. The area does have its own appeal; nearby Main Street has many ethnic restaurants, there is a nice small neighbourhood park- Robson Park, just a few blocks away. We stay because of its proximity to a Taoist Ta'i Chi Centre nearby. Also well located if visiting a patient at nearby St. Joseph's Hospital. I have stayed a couple of times at this hotel, and it scores very high in terms of value for price. Being from just outside the Greater Vancouver area, I know of dozens of nondescript hotels that are no great value, and a dozen or so truly exceptional 5 star establishments. But the Uptown is almost unique in being a genuinely 3.5 star rated hotel that is priced like a 2 star. There are under 60 rooms, some very oddly configured because of the wedge shape of the property. Very basic check in counter, with friendly staff and free newspapers. The breakfast room is adjacent- and my advice is to skip it and eat a hot breakfast next door at the Salt and Pepper for $5.95 ,owned by the hotel operators. Remember that each BW hotel is privately under a franchise system, so there is a both a ma/pa feel and a corporate neutrality to the place. Very secure parking as noted by other reviewers and the rooms have good beds, DSL internet gratis, the usual bathroom notions and amenities found in $150 hotels, not the $89 we paid. The toilets are crammed into a little corner, but there is just enough room. Granite topped vanity. A small contemplative 'garden terrace' is off the south side of the second floor, and a modest fitness room on the third. Free ice and in-room tea/coffee. One can order room service from the Salt and Pepper. Drawbacks? The Kingsway area has car dealerships and a convergence of traffic, so there is some noise and little intrinsic beauty. But there are some nice views from the north facing rooms. Great choice if on a budget, and want the assured quality standards mandated by Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: tqj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night of U2's concert. The hotel is just a couple of miles from the heart of the downtown core. I chose to walk, but busses run regularly along Broadway (one block away) or one can get there quickly in a cab. The hotel has very secure parking, a decent continental breakfast in the morning and is close to many local coffeehouses. The room was a bit smallish, but very nicely appointed and the staff was very helpful/courteous. Restaurant quality in the area is limited, but all in all, I was very pleased with the price and location. If you do not need to stay and pay for the bright lights of Downtown Vancouver, this Best Western is a good choice. If you stay here, come into Vancouver via 91N after crossing the border. Stay with the 91 until Knight Street exit, then a few miles to Kingsway. Hotel is about 2 miles on the right after accessing Kingsway. Great alternative route before the evening rush hour traffic starts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: DouglasKing425
Reviews.Content: For me a hotel cost has three parts, the room, parking and internet. This hotel is close to town, very reasonable room rates, free secure covered parking and free internet. The room was perhaps a little small for my wife and I but the high ceilings meant it did not feel cramped at all. Its close to downtown. A block from Broadway which has shopping and restaurants. A great deal and very convenient. We had the breakfast special at the adjacent grill. Regular fare done well and also reasonable. The hotel did have the usual breakfast bar with pastries, toast and cereals

Reviews.Title: “good if you have a car to move around”
Reviews.Author: geppe1970
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok. Comfortable, free parking, nice view if you are lucky enough to get a room oriented toward VC downtown. The room was nice. Free internet, and continental breakfast included, but in a very small room (there's even no place for everyone). This was the worst experience here. Despite the infamous breakfast room, I would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, well located, good value.”
Reviews.Author: cmagalha
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, excellent free breakfast, free indoor parking, free WiFi, across the street from a groceries market, friendly staff. Notes far from train station. 15 min drive from Canada Place and Gastown.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: sovernet
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Trip Advisor we found this to be ideally located. Not too close, not too far... from downtown. Very convenient public bus transport into the city. Convenient "underground/safe" parking. Rooms very large and attractive. Very clean, good housekeeping, fine front-desk operations. Fine little restaurant next door. Hotel has a fine continental breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but still close to tourist hub.”
Reviews.Author: Blackiesbeach
Reviews.Content: $10 cab ride to downtown Vancouver or buses easy. Stayed with adult daughter for 4 nights. 2 x double beds...small but good mattresses, comfy. Microwave in room was good addition, bathroom clean and ample space for 2 adults. Across from food store and mall...great shopping without the tourist prices ! Also fantastic shops down the street, lots of restaurants. We ate at the hotels restaurant 2 nights and the service andquality of food was very high whilst the prices reasonable. Free continental breakfast was basic but lots of places to eat nearby. Only drawback was the noisy air con...like a jet plane, we were told they are upgrading shortly. Because of 33.8 C temperatures we needed it and no breeze from windows. After 3rd night we got used to it....ALMOST ! Would stay again for at least 2 nights for the shopping.....local prices and great shops..IF they have replaced the air cons !!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet hotel near city centre”
Reviews.Author: lightning79
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and found it to be very nice. The evening staff was very pleasant and informative. The staff during the day was efficient, and business-like not as pleasant and attentive but ok nonetheless. The room was nicely appointed for the cost, but the toilet was awkwardly placed in my room almost like it was an afterthought and the King room was on the smallish side if 2 people were to be staying in it. The parking was *very* secure. Double gates with separate swipes were needed to get into the underground parking area. Only the lobby has wi-fi at this time, but I was told this was going to be changing in the next few months. It was no big deal as they had Cat 5 cords for guests and Ethernet outlets in the room so it was as good as in my opinion. I'd rather fast fixed line internet vs. slow wi-fi in any case. There was a decent breakfast during the day from what I saw (I didn't partake) and there was room service provided by a pub adjacent to the hotel. The gym had a nice view of the mountains with modern equipment. Transit was never a problem, and the hotel is right near a shopping mall with grocery store and drug store. Car repair and tire shops are also nearby should you need them. A nice neighbourhood - definitely cleaned up the area in the last few years. I would stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: sir1900
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. It was clean, comfortbale and service was friendly. Parking and check-in process was good. The only problem I had was the Internet didn't work. It wasn't important, because I was not there on business and all I needed to check was my email, which I did using my BlackBerry. The lobby computer worked, but was very slow and the printer didn't work, so we were unable to print our boarding passes after checking in online for our flight back home. Overall, it was still positive and I will stay here again next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_Explorer2009
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be what we expected, clean, comfortable and good value. We spent 3 nights here before touring BC and Alberta. The room was small with only double beds but the price was less than $90. The hotel is within 2 minutes of a bus stop that takes you to Downtown, Stanley Park, Metrotown. There are also a couple of places nearby to eat, the Pad Thai place was very nice anf there is a super market across the road. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this location for price, convenience and value !”
Reviews.Author: trafficagent
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Best Western Uptown. It is very convenient to downtown at a very reasonable price. The rooms are average size but have a couple of nice touches like bed top cushioned padding, a curved shower curtain and nice shampoos, mouthwash etc. They have secured underground parking (bring a small car because it is tight) included in your stay which was one of my conditions to stay as I had a vehicle. The complimentary breakfast is pretty basic compared to others such as Fairfield but is adequate... great bagels, pastries, fruit, but no hot items... Coffee is bad "Nescafe machine" but there is a "Waves" coffee shop (just like a Starbucks or Blenz) just one block away on main. There is coffee in the room which is better. Request a room on the side street or the back for a bit more quiet as Kingsway is busy with trucks etc.... The staff is helpful and they rooms are VERY clean. The hotel was supposedly built in 2000 and remodeled in 2006. They get a lot of visitors and occupancy but seem to be staying up with the traffic. It is just a 5 minute drive (depending on time of day & traffic) to get to Downtown... They do have a personal computer and printer in the lobby which you need to share with others but was generally available. No privacy however as the screen faces the desk and lobby, so use with caution if you are accessing personal information. There is a small resturant attached which shares the building but we did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MurielCTPortlandArea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 219, for two nights last October. The room had a comfortable king size bed, with a Jacuzzi and shower. The location is superb. Close to everything. I recommend using local transit to get around. The bus is minutes away and you can get downtown – local and Metro town shopping (Burnaby) - and variety of good restaurants either a walk away or short bus ride. Although the hotel is located on very busy streets, the room was very quiet. During our stay we had problems with the internet and the heater but the staff went out of their way to quickly resolve both problems. The hotel serves a continental breakfast available from 7:00 – 10:00. Although the breakfast room is a little small I appreciated the breakfast hours. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: VeroBeachEsther
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel from Trip Advisor reviews and it turned out to be a great value. We came in by train and it is an inexpensive taxi ride to this hotel. Bus #19 takes you downtown anytime (usual stops along the way) and goes straight to Stanley Park where you can take the free shuttle all around the park or walk the waterfront back thru downtown. Hotel was clean, the beds were great, rooms very spacious for the price. Close to shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Would not use again.”
Reviews.Author: Worldglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: I don't think we stayed at the same hotel as the reviewers as this hotel is a dump - a clean one but horrible non-the-less. We were left to our own devices as we struggled to get our luggage through the door, the reception clerk just watched. We had the minimum number of words from him and I fear my producing a Best Western Points card threw him completely as I don't ever expect for the points to materialise as he took the paperwork from me and said 'I will sort!'. Moving on - the corridors are grim, seriously grim lighting and more like the corridors of a youth hostel. They also smelt like public lavatories. Passing the windowless breakfrast room, we made our decision to pass on the complimentary breakfast. Whist all rooms are non-smoking, this one smelt of tobacco. It was very clean however and the bed very comfortable as were the pillows. The bathroom was tiny, only 1 person at a time could get in. Very early one morning I went to go into the bathroom to find the door had locked. I went to reception to report this and after tracking someone down (there was no-one at the desk), the person seemed put out and I was told that we must have locked it ourselves. Interesting considering we were outside and the lock was inside, we were also told we would have to wait until 8am until someone came to look at it. After searching around, we found we had packed a tool and we fixed it ourselves. After checking out we asked if we could store our luggage. Luggage storage is in the breakfast room - at least no-one can see it from the outside - there aren't any windows! If you want tags on your luggage you have to ask for them. We stayed out of this hotel as much as possible as it was simply too grim to spend any time in. We would definately not go back or recommend. As the location is some way out of the City, walk out of the hotel and turn right along the main road and call into the chemist in the mall which is next to the supermarker. Here you can buy an all day pass for $9. This covers the bus, sky bus and sea ferry. Further along the road (outside of themall) take the 19 to Stanley Park or the 8 to downtown. You can see all the attractions using the local buses but mainly the 19. in addition, pop into the library which is also in the mall for a bus/route timetable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable room. Excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Quokka7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in September. In fact I returned from Seattle a day earlier, so that I could stay an extra night at this hotel. It felt like I was coming home! The staff are very friendly, courteous and extremely knowlegeable. Nothing is too much trouble for them. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The hotel has a free Internet Service available for guests - very handy when you're in a foreign country! I also like the fact that it's only a very short walk to the bus stop where you can catch a bus to Downtown Vancouver and Stanley Park. The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but don't let that fool you. Appearances can be deceiving. It's clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. I think that the hotel is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Ray170
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel with nothing more than comments made on this site. Very, very pleased with the accommodation and staff quite ok, no problems. Although on a busy road, rooms quiet and small shopping centre nearby. Yes, it is a distance in to city but public transport reliable and taxis come when required. Only downside is the breakfast facility. The facility is very small and when we where there is was difficult to get seating.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Uptown Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: Thekansaspyet
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel conveniently located but out of downtown tourist crime area. Secured free parking on site in the building. Next door to grocery store. Good breakfast included in rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: Dewey1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights after an Alaskan cruise. Hotel is away from the downtown area of Vancouver, but has restaurants and services around it and is a short taxi ride to the city center. Room was very nice and we did have a view of the mountains. Continental breakfast was good, however has limited seating Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: dbliv
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2008. Comfortable and inexpensive option for Vancouver, especially if you have a car. Close to downtown. Staff is great. Near busy road but it was quiet inside the room. Gated but small parking garage so get your car back to the hotel at a decent hour in the evening if you want a space. Grocery store and mini-mall right across the street. Several restaurants within walking distance. Great place, will definitely stay here again next time we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Would Think Again When Staying in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: sfine
Reviews.Content: After reading past reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to book a short stay for some business at the Best Western Uptown. We were in town for a short time, rented a car and were not going to spend much time in the hotel. There were some minor complaints, such as the bed and pillows not being too comfortable, but what really irritated me was that our toilet overflowed and instead of an employee helping with the problem, a front desk employee came to our room and handed us a plunger for us to fix ourselves. The continental breakfast was plentiful, parking is free and the front desk staff was helpful when we decided to cut our stay a day short. If you are looking for an inexpensive room and have a rental car to get you around town ( motel is too far to walk to Robson St or any other tourist area) then you might want to check out the Best Western Uptown. For our next stay in Vancouver, we'll find another property.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for my type of trip”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Junkie_06
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Van for year and coming back to see friends & family, this time I wanted a hotel out with downtown where there was handy transport links as I had no car. This hotel is ideal for that being on a main street with plenty bus options and also15 mins walk to the Pacific bus station and sky train. Even though the hotel faces a busy road that sees traffic all night, my room that faced this road was relatively quiet thanks to the double glazing. Those that might see this as an issue should request a room away from the roadside and also the gym! The staff were very friendly, rooms basic and clean, with the breakfast being a simple continental affair that was just fine for me. I would say this hotel is one of the better BW hotels I’ve stayed in. For those first time visitors to Van that want to be a touching distance of the best of what Van has to offer, I would not recommend this hotel as there is not much around the area for tourists and really a car is needed. I would try my hand at a hotel off Robson and try stay away from Granville as it can be seedy at night. Overall the hotel was good for my type of trip offering a clean and friendly place to stay with tplenty ransport links for a past local.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bucknbacon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Uptown over the May long Weekend. I made reservations by telephone 4-6 weeks before arriving, however, upon arriving discovered that we had no room. The staff had no record of our reservation and when I provided the confirmation number the claimed it didn't exist. We were eventually given a room, but not the what we had originally reqested. The underground parking, although secure, is very small. Good luck if you drive a SUV, truck or larger vehicle . I've stayed a Best Western Hotels before and I'm usually a fan, but I'll definitely think twice before staying at one again, and when I'm in Vancouver again I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Penticton-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights, beginning Jan. 31. I found the hotel to be clean and quiet. I don't drive, but transit buses go by the front door every few minutes and it's very easy to get downtown. The staff were very helpful and friendly, without exception. Right next door to the hotel is a shopping mall with a liquor store, a drugstore, a supermarket and many other amenities (including a public library with transit maps). Very convenient location. Close by is Broadway, with east-west transit making shopping easy. Three very decent secondhand bookstores within a stone's throw and more coffeeshops than you can imagine in the Main Street / Broadway area. The hotel's free continental breakfast, from 7-10 am, was more than enough food. Cereals, bagels, croissants, breads, several kinds of fruit, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt and hot beverages every morning. I usually took mine back to my room but there was some seating in the breakfast room. Next door is the Salt and Pepper Grill, a great place for a lazy brunch or a steak sandwich. Good service and reasonable prices. The bathroom was very clean and the chambermaid service good. My room faced the busy street, but the double-glazed windows blocked 99% of the street noise. The in-room air conditioner and heater worked well. I would definitely stay again, and plan to this summer.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: nycjenn17
Reviews.Content: I read good reviews of this hotel here on TripAdvisor and I have to say they were all correct! The staff was so nice & helpful, and our room was very spacious, quiet and CLEAN. The hotel is walking distance (about 10 minutes) to a very busy area with shops, restaurants, etc., but the free parking is definitely a huge selling point. My only comment would be that if you are staying here and using the parking lot: bring a small car! The parking lot is quite small and somewhat difficult to negotiate, so I think that would be very difficult with a large SUV.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: okazon69
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel at least 30 nights per year, usually in one-week stays, and find it overall an excellent value and very good quality. The hotel is not the Fairmont, and doesn't pretend to be. However, at their very reasonable rates (down to $69 in the winter), what you get is worth every penny. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the location is very convenient for getting to various places around Vancouver, and the free parking is a nice bonus. The bedspreads and towels could be upgraded. Request a room with fridge and microwave if this could be useful to you. The front desk staff are all very helpful, and will gladly give you advice on places to go eat, or how to get around. Breakfast is basic but decent, with no hot choices available. It does get a bit repetitive after a few days, but there are ample choices in the area. The high speed wired Internet connection is consistently fast. There is also a terminal in the lobby including a laser printer, but which is very expensive. There is a good reason the gym closes at 8pm, and that is the noise it makes. If you are sensitive to this, do request a room away from the gym. Likewise, the noise from Kingsway is quite persistent day and night, so again, a room at the back of the hotel is preferable if this bothers you. As others have mentioned, the hotel is perhaps not in the very best area of town, but it is certainly not dangerous. The usual caution you would show in any large city applies here. Car theft is a major problem anywhere in the Vancouver area.

Reviews.Title: “very happy with my stay...you will be too!”
Reviews.Author: dakine77
Reviews.Content: My room was fairly modern, very clean and spacious (for 1). The staff was very helpful with directions and advice. There's not too much to do around the immediate neighborhood, but is safe and fairly quite (definitely better than downtown). Not the cheapest, but for a moderate rate, a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Two Best Posts Up!”
Reviews.Author: Poolian
Reviews.Content: A jewel in the rough. * First impressions: On corner of a busy street. Receptionist was gracious. I asked for a room NOT beneath the gym and he said "Oh, you must have been here before!" I had not...I had just read another Trip Advisor report! Thanks! * Customer Service: Excellent. I was able to stay a little longer because my flight took off late. * Room Service: Good food, fast service via a restaurant attached to the hotel next door. Priced OK. * Parking: Free parking in a double locked garage beneath and to the rear of the hotel. * In Room: Very clean and tidy. Room was well sized though not huge. There was a little noise from the street so you may want to ask for a room away from the main street. Air conditioning was noisy. * Location: Good for the price. * Overall: Very happy, would go again, would recommend to others e.g. on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a cheap price”
Reviews.Author: exibum
Reviews.Content: I have the say that this is one of the best hotel for its price. Booked it 14 days in advance and got about 60 CAD pernight. The room was clean and had everything you need, except for a safe to keep my passport and important documents, but that wouldnt matter much. Had everything i need in the room, tv, microwave, fridge and wireless internet. (The cable didnt work for me but the wireless was still fast). Although i am not sure if there is a microwave in every room, (I Requested for it) and they put me on the first floor, right beside the breakfast room. (Just few steps away) Room was very neatly done and very cozy, with high celings and very spaceous. I was pretty happy that they had a direct bus to UBC just half a block away, and also bus 19 goes directly to metrotown station. Walking to the skytrain isn't that bad since it only takes about 10-15mins. I am quite impressed with the service at the frontdesk as they were always friendly to guide you about the food around the area, and also the directions to places. Oh yeah, the free breakfast every morning was a bonus. Had bread, hot chocolate, cereals, juices, muffins, coffee and stuffs there. So overall, i would give this hotel a 5 star rating for the price and i would definitely recommend anyone to stay here. (If you do not mind that it's about 30mins from downtown and metrotown)

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Uptown Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 205 Kingsway, Vancouver, British Columbia V5T 3J5, Canada (Formerly Comfort Inn)
